member.name: T:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions
member.summary: These functions perform synchronous and asynchronous direct (without establishing permanent session) operations with output format type JSON.

member.name: T:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.JSON_FORMAT
member.summary: JSON output formats for Read, Update, New and Select

member.name: F:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.JSON_FORMAT.JSON
member.summary: Show the results of the operation in JSON format.

member.name: F:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.JSON_FORMAT.JSON_DICT
member.summary: Show the results of the operation in JSON_DICT format, using the dictionaries.

member.name: F:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.JSON_FORMAT.JSON_SCH
member.summary: Show the results of the operation in JSON_SCH format, using the schema properties..

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.Read(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,System.String,Linkar.ReadOptions,Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.JSON_FORMAT,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or several records of a file in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File name to read.
The records codes list to read, separated by the Record Separator character (30). Use StringFunctions.ComposeRecordIds to compose this string
List of dictionaries to read, separated by space. If dictionaries are not indicated the function will read the complete buffer.
Object that defines the different reading options of the Function: Calculated, dictClause, conversion, formatSpec, originalRecords.

's a free text that will travel until the database to make the admin being able to manage additional behaviours in the standard routine SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM. This routine will be called if the argument has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.Update(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,Linkar.UpdateOptions,Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.JSON_FORMAT,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Update one or several records of a file, in a synchronous way with JSON input and output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File name where you are going to write.
The records to be updated. Inside this string are the recordIds, the records, and the originalRecords. Use StringFunctions.ComposeUpdateBuffer function to compose this string.
Object that defines the different writing options of the Function: optimisticLockControl, readAfter, calculated, dictionaries, conversion, formatSpec, originalRecords.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.New(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,Linkar.NewOptions,Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.JSON_FORMAT,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates one or several records of a file, in a synchronous way with JSON input and output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File name where you are going to write.
The records to be written. Inside this string are the recordIds, and the records. Use StringFunctions.ComposeNewBuffer function to compose this string.
Object that defines the following writing options of the Function: recordIdType, readAfter, calculated, dictionaries, conversion, formatSpec, originalRecords.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.Delete(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,Linkar.DeleteOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes one or several records in file, in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
The file name where the records are going to be deleted. DICT in case of deleting a record that belongs to a dictionary.
The records list to be deleted. Use StringFunctions.ComposeDeleteBuffer function to compose this string.
Object that defines the different Function options: optimisticLockControl, recoverRecordIdType.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.Select(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Linkar.SelectOptions,Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.JSON_FORMAT,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes a Query in the Database, in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File name where the select operation will be perform. For example LK.ORDERS
Fragment of the phrase that indicate the selection condition. For example WITH CUSTOMER = '1'
Fragment of the phrase that indicates the selection order. If there is a selection rule, Linkar will execute a SSELECT, otherwise Linkar will execute a SELECT. For example BY CUSTOMER
Is the list of dictionaries to read, separated by space. If dictionaries are not indicated the function will read the complete buffer. For example CUSTOMER DATE ITEM
An optional statement that will execute before the main Select
Object that defines the different reading options of the Function: calculated, dictionaries, conversion, formatSpec, originalRecords, onlyItemId, pagination, regPage, numPage.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.Subroutine(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes a subroutine, in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
Subroutine name to execute.
Number of arguments
The subroutine arguments list.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.Conversion(Linkar.CredentialOptions,Linkar.CONVERSION_TYPE,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the result of executing ICONV() or OCONV() functions from a expression list in the Database, in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
Indicates the conversion type, input or output: Input=ICONV(); OUTPUT=OCONV()
The data or expression to convert. It can have MV marks, in which case the conversion will execute in each value obeying the original MV mark.
The conversion code. It will have to obey the Database conversions specifications.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.Format(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the result of executing the FMT function in a expressions list in the Database, in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
The data or expression to format. It can contain MV marks, in which case the conversion in each value will be executed according to the original MV mark.
Specified format
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.Dictionaries(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns all the dictionaries of a file, in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File name
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.Execute(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows the execution of any command from the Database in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
The command to execute in the Database.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.GetVersion(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows getting the server version, in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.LkSchemas(Linkar.CredentialOptions,Linkar.LkSchemaOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of all the Schemas defined in Linkar Schemas, or the EntryPoint account data files, in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
This object defines the different options in base of the asked Schema Type: LKSCHEMA, SQLMODE or DICTIONARY.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.LkProperties(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,Linkar.LkPropertiesOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the Schema properties list defined in Linkar Schemas or the file dictionaries, in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File name to LkProperties
This object defines the different options in base of the asked Schema Type: LKSCHEMA, SQLMODE or DICTIONARY.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.GetTable(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Linkar.TableOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a query result in a table format, in a synchronous way.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File or table name defined in Linkar Schemas. Table notation is: MainTable[.MVTable[.SVTable]]
Fragment of the phrase that indicate the selection condition. For example WITH CUSTOMER = '1'
Is the list of dictionaries to read, separated by space. If dictionaries are not indicated the function will read the complete buffer. For example CUSTOMER DATE ITEM
Fragment of the phrase that indicates the selection order. If there is a selection rule Linkar will execute a SSELECT, otherwise Linkar will execute a SELECT. For example BY CUSTOMER
Different function options: rowHeaders, rowProperties, onlyVisibe, usePropertyNames, repeatValues, applyConversion, applyFormat, calculated, pagination, regPage, numPage.
Free text sent to the database for custom processing. SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM will be called if this parameter has content.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.JsonFunctions.ResetCommonBlocks(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resets the COMMON variables with the 100 most used files in a synchronous way with JSON output format.
member.param: Object that defines the necessary data to access to the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).

The maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. By default 0 (wait indefinitely).
